channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold Edges Higher Ahead of U.S. Jobs Report
item.description: Gold edged higher in early Asian trade, ahead of the U.S. nonfarm payrolls report due later today.

item.title: India's Sensex Flat as Consumer, Industrial Stocks Support
item.description: India’s benchmark Sensex was flat as gains in consumer and industrial stocks helped offset losses in tech shares.

item.title: Victoria’s Secret says it won these ‘major moments’ as it bumps full-year sales forecast
item.description: Victoria’s Secret on Thursday raised its full-year sales outlook after making gains via the back-to-school season and a new sportswear launch, noting ...

item.title: Petco’s new CEO wants to make these changes to its stores, as shares gain
item.description: When Joel Anderson took the helm at Petco Health & Wellness Co. earlier this year, he said he wanted to improve the pet-supplies chain’s profitability...

item.title: Ulta Beauty’s full-year sales forecast is slightly better, and the company says it’s ‘gaining traction’ in competitive backdrop
item.description: Shares of Ulta Beauty Inc. rallied after hours on Thursday after the cosmetics chain offered up a slightly more upbeat full-year sales forecast, sayin...

item.title: Is This Wildly Overvalued Stock Market Doomed? Yes, but Maybe Not Yet
item.description: History shows no link between nosebleed valuations like we have today and returns over the next year. Expensive stocks can always get pricier.

item.title: Oil Edges Lower as Market Weighs OPEC Supply, China Demand
item.description: Oil edged lower in early Asian trade. Trade remains in a tight range despite OPEC’s decision to keep voluntary production cuts, ANZ Research said.

item.title: Trump names David Sacks as White House ‘AI and crypto czar’
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump said Thursday night that venture capitalist David Sacks will join his administration as “AI and crypto czar.”

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.4% to 100.02
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was down 0.4% to 100.02 — down for two of the past three trading days.

item.title: HPE sees more than 30% growth in server sales as AI boom rolls on
item.description: HPE’s stock has been the most understated of the three big AI server names this year.
